intro: Aster linosyris f. monocephalus, commonly known as the single-headed aster, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. This subspecies is native to regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and rocky soils. The plant typically blooms in late summer to early autumn, adding a subtle ornamental value to its habitat. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, contributing to its low-maintenance appeal in garden settings.
